item.title: Korean BBQ Taco Box
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:

The post Korean BBQ Taco Box appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Before starting this blog, there were a few food trucks that my wife and I followed on Twitter with the intention of trying them out. One of them was the Korean BBQ Taco Box because, well, if that doesn’t just sound like an amazing combination then maybe you shouldn’t be reading this blog. One Saturday a few weeks ago we saw through Twitter that one of their four trucks was only about a mile or so from our house and decided to give it a try. I’m so glad we did because it’s delicious. Tonight, despite the rain, we made our return visit.

I ordered the bulgogi taco, which is shredded beef cooked with onions and whatever is in their amazing sauce. The taco was good, but not out-of-this-world amazing like their galbi, which is cut spare-rib with onions. That’s what I had on our first visit and man is it delicious. The bulgogi is good too, but not the same calibre as the galbi. But what’s cool about the Taco Box, is that you just don’t get a taco, you get some amazing other little treats: a ginger salad; these fried cheese rolls, which are kind of like little fried cheese sushi pieces; a fried egg omelet, which is interesting; and fried tofu with teriyaki sauce which surprisingly I really like. But the biggest surprise of all is the spicy chicken wing that comes with each box. It’s so good that’s what Carla ordered tonight, a box of chicken wings… from the Korean BBQ Taco Box.

I don’t usually like spicy food, but the first time I ate one of their wings the flavor overpowered the heat and I didn’t even realize how spicy it was until I started coughing. Tonight I ate the wing that came with my box and two more that Carla couldn’t finish before my mouth was burning so much that I had to stop. Well, that and there weren’t any wings left.

If you haven’t tried the Korean BBQ Taco Box, follow them on Twitter and find out where they are. If they’re near you, check them out. You’ll be happy you did!

The post Korean BBQ Taco Box appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
